intro: Senecio dimorphophyllus subsp. intermedius, commonly known as the Intermediate Senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking, daisy-like inflorescences. The plant features succulent leaves that are often blue-green in color, adapted to arid environments. It produces yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, typical of the Asteraceae family. This subspecies is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soil.
